p: With regard to distributional change, overall migration route analysis shows migration southeast from the LIG to the LGM ( Fig. 3A), followed by migration northeast from the LGM to the present ( Fig. 3C) and migration northward from the present to 2080 ( Fig.Â 3E). From the LIG to the LGM, the expansion occurred mainly in the Sichuan Basin, with a source population from the most southeastern regions of China migrating northwest ( Fig. 3B). From the LGM to the present, the expansion occurred in southeast China, with a relatively short migration distance ( Fig. 3D). Northward expansion is the dominant tendency from the present to 2080 ( Fig. 3F).
